techmeme.title: At an Acquired podcast event, Zuckerberg said he's done with apologizing and his biggest mistake was taking too much ownership for issues out of Meta's control (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
Microsoft plans to make changes to Windows that will help CrowdStrike, Broadcom, and other security vendors operate outside of the Windows kernel (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Nick Clegg says Elon Musk turned X into "a sort of one man, sort of hyper-partisan and ideological hobby horse", contrasting Meta's content moderation with X's (Vincent Manancourt/Politico)
Facebook and Instagram make AI labels less prominent on content edited with AI, moving them behind a menu; the labels will still appear on AI-generated content (The Verge)
Sources: Spotify is trying to entice video-oriented creators to distribute shows on the platform in addition to YouTube, sometimes offering them seven figures (Ashley Carman/Bloomberg)
